function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Unoccupied buildings presenting considerable energy consumption","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Basal energy use due to inefficiency and organizational culture","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Basal energy use attributed to stand-by and vital loads","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Zoonotic transmission from live wild animal trade market","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"International travel contributing to the spread of covid-19","category":"Social and Cultural risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High rate of global spread due to air travel","category":"Social and Cultural risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission through aerosol acknowledged by who","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to self-isolation and quarantine measures","category":"Social and Cultural risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Initial approach towards social distancing and self-isolation may not have been sufficient to prevent a high death count","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High number of overseas arrivals during lockdown may have contributed to the spread of the virus","category":"Social and Cultural risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relaxation of social distancing measures may lead to increased transmission of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear transmission routes and factors for covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contradictory findings on the influence of temperature and humidity on covid-19 transmission","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent findings on the association of temperature and uv radiation with covid-19 cases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 in highly populated cities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of urbanization on disease propagation","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of policy focus on urban context for covid-19","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate data collection methods for covid-19 cases and climatic indicators","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lag between date of actual cases and date of reporting","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Population density as a factor in covid-19 spread","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of mixed-effects model to analyze covid-19 cases in different cities.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumption of independent and identically distributed residuals in the model.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Multivariate normal assumption for the distribution of random effects.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Modeling the spread of contagious diseases such as covid-19 in cities.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharp increase in daily new cases and total confirmed cases for london","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High number of deaths related to covid-19 in london","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding and space issues in a city like london","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Moderate negative correlation between temperature and covid-19 cases and deaths","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negligible correlation between temperature and covid-19 cases and deaths","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reported impacts of humidity and temperature on covid-19 transmission and mortality rate","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative association between climatic parameters and covid-19 cases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited depth analysis based on resistivity from viruses, population mobility, and individual health factors","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of city-level factors on covid-19 transmission","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability of covid-19 cases across different cities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconclusive correlation between covid-19 transmission and climatic parameters","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global transmission of covid-19 across diverse climates","category":"Global and International risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High population density in big cities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reproductive number r greater than 1","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Second wave of covid-19 in different cities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor housing conditions with inadequate sanitation facilities and fresh water supply increase outbreak risks","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Encroachment of natural habitats and closer encounters with wildlife increase the risk of zoonotic infections","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and confined spaces in buildings increase covid-19 transmission risk","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher ventilation rate and open windows may lead to increased exposure to air pollution and allergens.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited green space and space between buildings may lead to a higher risk of disease transmission.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High usage of crowded public transport increases the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negligible correlation between the number of confirmed new cases with minimum and maximum temperature","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Threat of a second wave of covid-19 and future pandemics","category":"Global and International risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High rate of virus positivity from floor swab samples in icu and gw, indicating contamination of the built environment.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High rate of virus positivity on surfaces frequently touched by medical staff or patients, such as computer mice, trash cans, handrails, and doorknobs.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High rate of virus positivity on patient masks due to exhaled droplets and oral secretions.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
